s.text: The Supplementary Information published in the Federal Register includes the full text of the Commission's Final Regulatory Flexibility Analysis.

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Federal Communications Commission, entitled "Access to Telecommunications Equipment and Services by Persons With Disabilities" (FCC-96-285).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Federal Communications Commission, entitled "Access to Telecommunications Equipment and Services by Persons With Disabilities" (FCC-96-285).
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.

The Commission also changed the effective date of the letter stamping requirement from the effective date of the Report and Order to April 1, 1997, to give importers and manufacturers time to make equipment changes.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.
As a result of comments from groups representing persons with hearing disabilities and the Office of Management and Budget, the Commission modified its date stamp proposal in the Report and Order.
Under current rules, the date of manufacture is optional.

Finally, the Commission considered two significant alternatives that could minimize the impact on small businesses: (1) not including within the purview of "telephones provided for emergency use" those telephones in workplace noncommon areas, in confined settings and in hotels and motels and (2) not requiring volume controls on the covered telephones.
It also concluded that any costs are significantly outweighed by the benefits to be achieved.
